box.content: Open-source container orchestration system for automating deployment, scaling, and management

list.text: Origin - Google Borg system, donated to CNCF in 2014
Ecosystem - Rich set of tools and extensions

note.text: Fun fact: Kubernetes means "helmsman" or "pilot" in Greek - k8s is the abbreviation!

list.text: Portability - Run anywhere: cloud, on-prem, hybrid, edge
Edge Computing - IoT and edge device management
Pods - Smallest deployable unit, runs one or more containers
Cluster - Set of nodes managed by Kubernetes
Deployment - Declarative updates for Pods and ReplicaSets

# Cluster information
kubectl cluster-info                    # Display cluster info
kubectl get nodes                       # List all nodes
kubectl version                         # Client and server version

# Basic operations
kubectl get pods                        # List pods in current namespace
kubectl get pods -A                     # List all pods in all namespaces
kubectl describe pod <pod-name>         # Detailed pod information
kubectl logs <pod-name>                 # Pod logs
kubectl exec -it <pod-name> -- bash     # Execute command in pod

# Resource management
kubectl apply -f manifest.yaml          # Create/update resources
kubectl delete -f manifest.yaml         # Delete resources
kubectl create deployment nginx --image=nginx  # Imperative create

# Namespace operations
kubectl get namespaces                  # List namespaces
kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=my-namespace  # Switch namespace

# Debugging and troubleshooting
kubectl get events --sort-by=.metadata.creationTimestamp  # Recent events
kubectl top nodes                        # Resource usage (nodes)
kubectl top pods                         # Resource usage (pods)
kubectl port-forward svc/my-service 8080:80  # Port forwarding

# Configuration and context
kubectl config get-contexts             # List contexts
kubectl config use-context my-cluster   # Switch context
kubectl config view                     # View kubeconfig

# Batch operations
kubectl get pods --selector app=nginx   # Filter by label
kubectl delete pods --all               # Delete all pods in namespace
kubectl scale deployment my-app --replicas=5  # Scale deployment

# YAML operations
kubectl get pod my-pod -o yaml          # Get resource as YAML
kubectl explain pods                    # Documentation for resource
kubectl api-resources                   # List all API resources

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: nginx-pod
  labels:
    app: nginx
    environment: development
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx-container
    image: nginx:1.21
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
    env:
    - name: ENVIRONMENT
      value: "development"
    resources:
      requests:
        memory: "64Mi"
        cpu: "250m"
      limits:
        memory: "128Mi"
        cpu: "500m"
  restartPolicy: Always

Key Fields:
â€¢ apiVersion: Kubernetes API version
â€¢ kind: Type of resource (Pod, Deployment, etc.)
â€¢ metadata: Name, labels, annotations
â€¢ spec: Desired state of the resource
â€¢ containers: Container specifications
â€¢ resources: CPU and memory requirements

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment
  labels:
    app: nginx
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 1
      maxUnavailable: 0
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:1.21
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: 80
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: 80
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10

Deployment Benefits:
â€¢ Maintains desired number of replicas
â€¢ Rolling updates and rollbacks
â€¢ Self-healing (replaces failed pods)
â€¢ Scalable replica counts

# Service Manifest
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: nginx-service
spec:
  selector:
    app: nginx
  ports:
  - name: http
    port: 80
    targetPort: 80
  type: ClusterIP  # Also: NodePort, LoadBalancer

---

# Ingress Manifest
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: nginx-ingress
  annotations:
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/rewrite-target: /
spec:
  rules:
  - host: myapp.example.com
    http:
      paths:
      - path: /
        pathType: Prefix
        backend:
          service:
            name: nginx-service
            port:
              number: 80

Service Types:
â€¢ ClusterIP: Internal cluster IP (default)
â€¢ NodePort: Expose on node IPs
â€¢ LoadBalancer: Cloud load balancer
â€¢ ExternalName: External service reference

box.content: Gradual replacement of old pods with new ones
box.code:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: myapp-rolling
spec:
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 25%        # Maximum additional pods during update
      maxUnavailable: 25%  # Maximum unavailable pods during update
  replicas: 4
  template:
    # ... pod template ...

Rolling Update Process:
1. New ReplicaSet created with updated version
2. Old pods gradually terminated, new pods created
3. Service load balancer distributes traffic
4. Process continues until all pods are updated

Benefits:
â€¢ Zero downtime deployment
â€¢ Automatic rollback on failure
â€¢ Gradual traffic migration
â€¢ Health checks ensure stability

Commands:
kubectl rollout status deployment/myapp-rolling
kubectl rollout history deployment/myapp-rolling
kubectl rollout undo deployment/myapp-rolling

# Blue Environment (v1.0)
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: myapp-blue
  labels:
    version: "1.0"
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: myapp
      version: "1.0"
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: myapp
        version: "1.0"
    # ... container spec ...

---

# Green Environment (v1.1)
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: myapp-green
  labels:
    version: "1.1"
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: myapp
      version: "1.1"
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: myapp
        version: "1.1"
    # ... container spec ...

---

# Service pointing to current version
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: myapp-service
spec:
  selector:
    app: myapp
    version: "1.0"  # Switch to "1.1" for green deployment
  ports:
  - port: 80

Process:
1. Deploy new version alongside old (green)
2. Test new version internally
3. Update service selector to switch traffic
4. Remove old deployment (blue)

# PersistentVolumeClaim (User requests storage)
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: my-pvc
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 10Gi
  storageClassName: fast-ssd

---

# Pod using PersistentVolumeClaim
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: app-with-storage
spec:
  containers:
  - name: app
    image: nginx
    volumeMounts:
    - name: storage-volume
      mountPath: /data
  volumes:
  - name: storage-volume
    persistentVolumeClaim:
      claimName: my-pvc

Access Modes:
â€¢ ReadWriteOnce (RWO): Single node read-write
â€¢ ReadOnlyMany (ROX): Multiple nodes read-only
â€¢ ReadWriteMany (RWX): Multiple nodes read-write

Storage Classes:
â€¢ fast-ssd: SSD storage
â€¢ standard-hdd: HDD storage
â€¢ cloud-specific: aws-ebs, azure-disk, gce-pd

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: mysql
spec:
  serviceName: "mysql"
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: mysql
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: mysql
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: mysql
        image: mysql:8.0
        env:
        - name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: mysql-secret
              key: password
        volumeMounts:
        - name: data
          mountPath: /var/lib/mysql
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes: [ "ReadWriteOnce" ]
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 20Gi

StatefulSet Characteristics:
â€¢ Stable, unique network identifiers
â€¢ Persistent storage for each replica
â€¢ Ordered, graceful deployment and scaling
â€¢ Ordered, graceful deletion and termination
â€¢ Unique: mysql-0, mysql-1, mysql-2

# ServiceAccount for application
apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: my-app-sa
  namespace: default

---

# Role with specific permissions
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: Role
metadata:
  namespace: default
  name: pod-reader
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources: ["pods"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]

---

# RoleBinding to grant permissions
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: RoleBinding
metadata:
  name: read-pods
  namespace: default
subjects:
- kind: ServiceAccount
  name: my-app-sa
  namespace: default
roleRef:
  kind: Role
  name: pod-reader
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io

---

# Pod using ServiceAccount
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: my-pod
spec:
  serviceAccountName: my-app-sa
  containers:
  - name: app
    image: my-app:latest

RBAC Components:
â€¢ ServiceAccount: Identity for processes in pods
â€¢ Role: Namespace-scoped permissions
â€¢ ClusterRole: Cluster-scoped permissions
â€¢ RoleBinding: Grants permissions within namespace
â€¢ ClusterRoleBinding: Grants cluster-wide permissions

# Secret for sensitive data
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: api-credentials
type: Opaque
data:
  username: YWRtaW4=  # base64 encoded 'admin'
  password: cGFzc3dvcmQ=  # base64 encoded 'password'

---

# NetworkPolicy for pod isolation
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: database-policy
  namespace: default
spec:
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      app: database
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress
  ingress:
  - from:
    - podSelector:
        matchLabels:
          app: webapp
    ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      port: 5432

Security Best Practices:
â€¢ Use Secrets for sensitive data (encrypted at rest)
â€¢ Implement Network Policies for traffic control
â€¢ Use Pod Security Standards
â€¢ Enable audit logging
â€¢ Regular security scanning

# Install Prometheus Stack with Helm
helm repo add prometheus-community https://prometheus-community.github.io/helm-charts
helm repo update

  --namespace monitoring \
  --create-namespace \
  --set grafana.adminPassword=admin \
  --set prometheus.prometheusSpec.retentionSize=10GB

# Access Grafana (port-forward)
kubectl port-forward -n monitoring svc/prometheus-grafana 8080:80

# Access Prometheus
kubectl port-forward -n monitoring svc/prometheus-kube-prometheus-prometheus 9090:9090

Key Metrics to Monitor:
â€¢ Cluster: Node CPU/Memory, Pod capacity
â€¢ Application: Request rate, error rate, latency
â€¢ Kubernetes: Pod restarts, deployment status
â€¢ Storage: Volume usage, IOPS

Alerts to Configure:
â€¢ Node down or not ready
â€¢ Pod crash loops
â€¢ High resource utilization
â€¢ Persistent volume full
